metadata.title: CVE-2016-4480 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The guest_walk_tables function in arch/x86/mm/guest_walk.c in Xen 4.6.x andearlier does not properly handle the Page Size (PS) page table entry bit atthe L4 and L3 page table levels, which might allow local guest OS users togain privileges via a crafted mapping of memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4480` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.6 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.5-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-hypervisor-4.6-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-system-armhf - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-utils-4.6 - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xen-utils-common - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
xenstore-utils - 4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.6.0-1ubuntu4.1').
